textRegions.text: How do we convert from free to paid users?
What’s the process like for a first-time user?
Is the service easy to use in an emergency?
Does the service provide peace of mind?
How can the service grow organically?
What problem does the service solve?
The service revolutionizes the emergency response system by delivering critical information faster. It saves lives and gives peace of mind to caregivers.
How are people currently using the service?
“On-boarding is the process of turning a first-time user
into a repeat customer... A successful on-boarding process
will explain a product and demonstrate its value in an enjoyable way.”

“This is really frustrating.
Why are there so many steps?”

“I had to set it up for my mom.
She couldn’t figure out how to get
past the first contact screen.”

High drop-off rates
and low satisfaction
Lengthy processes have higher drop-off rates.
It’s harder to complete complex forms on the mobile phone.

Sandy
Director of Senior Support Solutions

The service should be fast and as
easy to use as 911 and Lifeline
Changing current emergency patterns is difficult
Some customers experience some peace of mind, but can use improvement
Marketing site can be a key place to establish initial trust and peace of mind
What’s the best way to convert free to paid?
Frequent engagement and increase of value over time
Frequent engagement and increase of value over time
How do we make the service grow organically?
Users don’t see the immediate value in the current product, therefore they won’t pass on the value.
Caregivers who see the value will naturally spread the word to potential customers.
On-boarding process is cumbersome on mobile device
It needs to be as easy and as fast as 911/Lifeline
Caregivers will pay for the value the service already provides
Viral growth comes from caregivers, not users
Focus on marketing site as the funnel for new subscribers.
Separate on-boarding experience from the emergency experience.
App becomes a 1 touch emergency button but faster
